metadata.jobDescription:
Product Manager, Developer Tools - Figma

Location: San Francisco, CA • New York, NY • United States (Remote option available)
Salary: $164,000 - $294,000 USD

Key Responsibilities:
- Collaborating across functions to build developer-focused features that streamline design-to-code workflow
- Establishing product direction, strategy, and roadmaps aligned with organizational and user objectives
- Managing the complete product development cycle from research through launch
- Working alongside Design, Engineering, and leadership teams on both strategy and delivery
- Making prioritization decisions based on user research, metrics, and business goals
- Incorporating emerging AI technologies where they enhance user value
- Coordinating with other Figma teams to maximize developer-facing benefits

Required Qualifications:
- 5+ years as a full-time Product Manager
- 2+ years in the developer tools sector
- Track record leading complex, high-stakes product initiatives
- Demonstrated success shipping quality software with measurable user and business outcomes
- Strong communication and analytical abilities

Nice-to-Have:
- Frontend development experience
- Production experience with large language models

hero.subheadline: Developer tools PM with 8+ years shipping SDKs and CLI experiences. From Flow developer onboarding to institutional staking APIs—I make complex systems accessible. Now drawn to where design meets code.

about.tagline: Eight years shipping developer tools where technical depth meets developer empathy—from blockchain CLI experiences to SDK architectures serving millions of API calls.
bio:
At Anchorage Digital, I lead protocol integrations serving institutional clients. Before that, I owned developer experience at Dapper Labs—shipping the Flow CLI and Cadence Playground redesign that reduced time-to-first-deploy by 60%. At Forte, I built Wallet-as-a-Service SDKs for AAA gaming studios. At Ankr, I created Ankr.JS and Advanced APIs that powered 1M+ daily requests. I've spent years thinking about developer onboarding, API ergonomics, and what makes tools feel intuitive.
I've used Figma professionally for years—it's genuinely how I think through product problems. The design-to-code gap is one I've lived on both sides: as a PM shipping developer tools, and as someone who relies on design systems to ship faster. Figma's mission to bridge that gap resonates deeply. I'm particularly excited about AI-enhanced workflows—I've been building AI agent orchestration as a side project and see real opportunity to make developers' lives easier.

Built Ankr.JS SDK and Advanced APIs serving 1M+ daily requests. Developer platform thinking at scale.
SDK architecture for external developers (gaming studios). API design and developer empathy.
Cross-functional coordination, process frameworks, working with engineering teams.
API design at enterprise scale, pioneering new technology adoption.
